itu.beddernet.approuter
Interface IBeddernetService

All Known Implementing Classes:
IBeddernetService.Stub
public interface IBeddernetService

Example of defining an interface for calling on to a remote service (running in another process).

Nested Class Summary
static class IBeddernetService.Stub
          Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

Method Detail

registerCallback

long registerCallback(IBeddernetServiceCallback cb,
                      java.lang.String applicationIdentifier)
                      throws android.os.RemoteException
Often you want to allow a service to call back to its clients. This shows how to do so, by registering a callback interface with the service.

Throws:
android.os.RemoteException

unregisterCallback

void unregisterCallback(IBeddernetServiceCallback cb,
                        java.lang.String applicationIdentifier)
                        throws android.os.RemoteException
Remove a previously registered callback interface.

Throws:
android.os.RemoteException

sendUnicast

void sendUnicast(java.lang.String networkAddress,
                 java.lang.String recipientApplicationIdentifier,
                 byte[] appMessage,
                 java.lang.String applicationIdentifier)
                 throws android.os.RemoteException
Send a unicast message. recipientApplicationIdentifier should be null unless message should be sent to a different application address .

Throws:
android.os.RemoteException

sendMulticast

void sendMulticast(java.lang.String[] networkAddress,
                   java.lang.String recipientApplicationIdentifier,
                   byte[] appMessage,
                   java.lang.String applicationIdentifier)
                   throws android.os.RemoteException
Send a multicast message The service can be null. Default service string is used.

getApplicationSupport

                              java.lang.String applicationIdentifier)
                              throws android.os.RemoteException
Check whether this service is supported by a particular device. If applicationIdentifier is null, the applicationIdentifierHash is used

Throws:
android.os.RemoteException

setInvocable

void setInvocable(java.lang.String intentURI,
                  boolean invokable,
                  java.lang.String applicationIdentifier)
                  throws android.os.RemoteException
This tells the scatternet whether it should try to wake the application up. this is an optional feature, implementation depends on platform etc. This would be useful e.g. to start up some messaging application or online logger etc. Set as true if the app behind should be invokeable i.e. if you ever run quake the AR remembers, if someone asks the AR "does he have quake" the reply will be "yes but it's trned off" the AR could then send a request to the user, "do you want to run quake now?" need to think about what is spam, what should be allowed etc. default: false

Throws:
android.os.RemoteException
